授業目的: This is an introductory course on cost and management accounting where students will learn to use a variety of cost and management accounting concepts and techniques for decision making in both manufacturing and service organizations.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
1. Explain the terminology, basic concepts and principles of cost and management accounting
2. Classify and analyze the various types of costs in a manufacturing company
3. Evaluate and prepare different managerial accounting statements
4. Understand job order, process costing, and activity based costing
5. Compute necessary managerial accounting information;
6. Calculate and allocate overhead costs to product manufacturing
7. Understand how to prepare budgets and how to determine and interpret different variances from budgets
8. Use relevant cost techniques for decision making
授業方法:
The course will be offered using "Online Format: Simultaneous and Two-way". Classes will be held at the time specified in the timetable via interactive live streaming using Zoom. Study materials (i.e., power point slides, exercises, and home assignment) will be uploaded in LUNA one week in advance. Students are strongly encouraged to read the materials before joining online class. It would be helpful to note down the key concepts in each chapter to discuss in the online session.
In each online session, at first the instructor will clarify the key concepts of a chapter to the students. Then, the students will solve a number of related problems. This process will ensure that the students acquire adequate technical competencies as well as comprehend the underlying rationale and effectiveness of accounting practices.
Individual assignments will be from end-of-chapter problems. On average, students should spend 3/4 hours working on each assignment.
Mid-term report and final report: In both the reports students are required to solve some exercises related to the topics covered in the class.

トピック.授業外学習2:
Participation in class discussion is an important part of the course. Quantity and quality of questions, comments, contributions and insights offered during class are important to the success of the course and students will be graded for their overall engagement and participation. Students are expected to review each chapter in advance to prepare for the next class.
Students also need to spend 3/4 hours in each week to submit the individual assignments.
At last, students are required to sit for a comprehensive final examination. This exam will be largely based on the lecture materials and end-of-chapter problems. As there will be multiple choice questions, students must have clarity in understanding this subject.
